p:
Since the first coronavirus epidemic, science has never been so globally connected. During the first coronavirus outbreak, SARS-CoV, there had already been five deaths when China told the world. In the current pandemic, no patients had died yet when China reported to the World Health Organization. The SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified one week after the new outbreak was reported.
41 In Brazil, only 48 h after the first infection was reported in the city of São Paulo, Professor Ester Sabino's team, from the School of Medicine of São Paulo University, sequenced the SARS-CoV-2 genome, helping to understand the proliferation of the virus and its mutations, in addition to helping global science to fight the disease.
42
